parallel

Class UnboundedBufferArrayUnsynchronized

  • java.lang.Object
    • parallel.UnboundedBufferArrayUnsynchronized
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BufferIntf

    public class UnboundedBufferArrayUnsynchronized
extends java.lang.Object
implements BufferIntf
    an unbounded-length FIFO buffer implemented as an Object Array that's totally unsynchronized. It's exactly the same as the BoundedBufferArrayUnsynchronized class, only that's completely unbounded (until out-of-memory-exceptions are thrown), therefore certain exceptions are never thrown.

    Title: popt4jlib

    Description: A Parallel Meta-Heuristic Optimization Library in Java

    Copyright: Copyright (c) 2015-2020

    Company:

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Ioannis T. Christou

    • Method Detail

      • addElement

        public void addElement(java.lang.Object obj)
                throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        add an object in the buffer. If the current buffer is full, it is resized by getting a buffer of size twice the current size.
        Specified by:
        addElement in interface BufferIntf
        Parameters:
        obj - Object
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if argument is null

      • remove

        public java.lang.Object remove()
                        throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
        remove the first object that was inserted in the buffer.
        Specified by:
        remove in interface BufferIntf
        Returns:
        Object the object that is removed from the buffer
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the buffer is empty.

      • remove

        public java.lang.Object remove(int i)
                        throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
        removes the i-th element in this array and returns it. Much slower than the other operations unless i is zero or size()-1 in which case, the operation is O(1) also.
        Parameters:
        i - int
        Returns:
        Object the element previously in the i-th position.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the index is out of the range {0,...size()-1}
